objectives: Understand the basic structure and characteristics of the dataset.
Detect any obvious data quality issues.

methods: Use pandas to load 'train.csv' and 'test.csv' into DataFrames.
Inspect the first few rows using df.head() to ensure data is loaded correctly.
Use df.info() to get an overview of the data types and non-null counts.
Check the shape of the DataFrames using df.shape to understand the number of rows and columns.
Use df.describe() to get summary statistics for numerical features.
Use df.describe(include=['O']) to get summary statistics for categorical features.
Identify any missing values using df.isnull().sum().
Use seaborn and matplotlib to create histograms for numerical features.
Create bar plots for categorical features to understand their distributions.
Plot survival rates against key features (e.g., Pclass, Sex, Age) to identify initial patterns.
